get_min_sample_size: Heuristic starting-n for binary/continuous/survival prediction

Source: R/engines.R
get_min_sample_size.Rd

get_min_sample_size: Heuristic starting-n for binary/continuous/survival prediction

Usage

get_min_sample_size(
  npar,
  prevalence = NULL,
  c_stat = NULL,
  calib_slope = NULL,
  epv_value = NULL,
  outcome_type = c("binary", "survival", "continuous")
)

Arguments

npar

integer. Number of predictors in the model

prevalence

numeric 0,1. An optional event rate or case‐fraction (binary or survival). Used for EPV calculations.

c_stat

numeric >0.5. Anticipated c‐statistic (discrimination). (optional; factor >1/c_stat) (TODO: Explain)

calib_slope

numeric. Anticipated calibration slope. (optional; factor 1/calib_slope if <1) (TODO: Explain)

outcome_type

Outcome type. Must be one of "binary", "survival", or "continuous".

Value

            integer. Recommended starting value from which to calculate the minimum sample size

Examples

get_min_sample_size(npar = 5, prevalence = 0.2, c_stat = 0.75,
                    calib_slope = 0.9, outcome_type = "binary")
#> Error in get_min_sample_size(npar = 5, prevalence = 0.2, c_stat = 0.75,     calib_slope = 0.9, outcome_type = "binary"): could not find function "get_min_sample_size"
